etymology.description: 美术 (fine arts) + 馆 (hall/building) = art museum/gallery.
etymology.interpretation: Denotes a public building dedicated to displaying and studying fine arts. Commonly refers to art museums and galleries.
etymology.simplification: 术 and 馆 are simplified: 術 → 术 reduces strokes; 館 → 馆 replaces the food radical 飠 with 饣 and streamlines the form.

parts.english: hall; building for public activities; establishment; shop

examples.chinese: 周末我们去美术馆参观新展览(週末我們去美術館參觀新展覽)。
examples.pinyin: Zhōumò wǒmen qù Měishùguǎn cānguān xīn zhǎnlǎn.
examples.english: This weekend we’re going to the art museum to see the new exhibition.

examples.chinese: 这座美术馆免费开放(這座美術館免費開放)，每周一闭馆(每週一閉館)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè zuò Měishùguǎn miǎnfèi kāifàng, měi zhōuyī bìguǎn.
examples.english: This art museum has free admission and is closed every Monday.

examples.chinese: 孩子们在美术馆参加水墨画工作坊(孩子們在美術館參加水墨畫工作坊)。
examples.pinyin: Háizimen zài Měishùguǎn cānjiā shuǐmòhuà gōngzuòfāng.
examples.english: The children joined an ink-painting workshop at the art museum.
